name: Brownie Beastrider
description: The Brownie Beastrider is a tiny fey creature known for its nimbleness, adorned with earthy tones that blend into forested environments. It can typically be seen riding a mount and exudes a magical presence.
memorable: Its ability to summon and communicate with animals makes the Brownie Beastrider a unique and valuable ally in combat scenarios.
goals: The Beastrider aims to assist its allies and maintain harmony with nature by leveraging its magical abilities and commanding animal allies.
relations: Often encountered with various woodland creatures and other fey beings, it may serve as a protector of its forest home.
environment: Commonly found in forested areas and natural settings, where it can easily interact with animals.
strengths: Possesses Magic Resistance, which provides an advantage against spells and magical effects, as well as the ability to summon animal allies.
weaknesses: Low Strength makes it weak in direct combat, relying mainly on agility and magic.
attacks: It can perform multiattacks with its Branch Spear or coordinate attacks with its mount, dealing piercing damage effectively.
most_powerful_ability: Invisibility allows it to vanish and gain a tactical advantage in combat, making it difficult to target.
senses: Has a noteworthy passive perception of 14, showcasing its keen awareness of surroundings.
additional_information: Can communicate with beasts to influence their behavior.
It ensures its mount is immune to charm and fright effects.
Magic allows it to perform prestidigitation and mending at will, providing useful utilities.
Can summon small predator animals or a bear to aid in combat once per day.
Exceptional Dexterity grants it a +5 acrobatics skill.
spellcasting: It can cast spells like mending and prestidigitation at will without components.
test_queries: tiny fey creature that commands animals
magic resistant creature with animal allies
agile creature that can summon beasts
supportive fey that rides a mount
